However, the mentioned substances (cholesterol, triglyceride, and LDL) can be associated with various diseases when their levels are abnormal. For instance, high levels of cholesterol and triglycerides can lead to conditions like hypercholesterolemia and hypertriglyceridemia, respectively. Elevated LDL levels can cause atherosclerosis and heart disease. But in the given context, no disease is explicitly stated to be present.
